p:
Without loss of generality, one can linearise indicator constraints of the type
y = 0 → a x ≤ b ,
for a binary variable y and a non-negative integer variable x, introducing a non-negative slack variable s and transforming inequality ax ≤ b into
a x + s ≤ b
. Then the “big- M” inequality s ≤ My enforces the indicator constraint.
